verses.text: If thou be made the master \add of the feast\add*, lift not thyself up, \add But\add* be among them as one of the rest; Take diligent care for them, and so sit down.
And when thou hast done all thy office, take thy place, That thou mayest be merry with them, And receive a crown for \add thy\add* well ordering \add of the feast\add*.
Speak, \add thou that art\add* the elder, for it becometh thee, but with sound judgment; And hinder not musick.
Pour not out words where \add there is\add* a musician, And shew not forth wisdom out of time.
A concert of musick in a banquet of wine \add Is as\add* a signet of carbuncle set in gold.
As a signet of an emerald set in a work of gold, \add So is\add* the melody of musick with pleasant wine.
Speak, young man, if \add there be\add* need of thee: \add And yet\add* scarcely when thou art twice asked.
Let thy speech be short, \add comprehending\add* much in few \add words;\add* Be as one that knoweth and yet holdeth his tongue.
If thou be among great men, make not thyself equal \add with them;\add* And when ancient men \add are in place\add*, use not many words.
Before the thunder goeth lightning; And before a shamefast \add man\add* shall go favour.
Rise up betimes, and be not the last; \add But\add* get thee home without delay.
There take thy pastime, and do what thou wilt: But sin not by proud speech.
And for these \add things\add* bless him that made thee, And hath replenished thee with his good \add things\add*.
Whoso feareth the Lord will receive his discipline; And they that seek \add him\add* early shall find favour.
He that seeketh the law shall be filled therewith: But the hypocrite will be offended thereat.
They that fear the Lord shall find judgment, And shall kindle justice as a light.
A sinful man will not be reproved, But findeth an excuse according to his will.
A man of counsel will be considerate; But a strange and proud \add man\add* is not daunted with fear, Even when of himself he hath done without counsel.
Do nothing without advice; And when thou hast once done, repent not.
Go not in a way wherein \add thou\add* mayest fall, And stumble not among the stones.
Be not confident in a plain way.
And beware of thine own children.
In every good work trust thy own soul; For this is the keeping of the commandments.
He that believeth in the Lord taketh heed to the commandment; And he that trusteth in him shall fare never the worse.
